97.definição: Movement of a body part toward or across the midline.

116.definição: If it's acute, it's strong or intense or comes on suddenly.

128.definição: Another term for alcohol dependenceA chronic, progressive disease characterized by excessive and often compulsive drinking, impaired control over drinking, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol use is discontinued. Also known as alcoholism.

129.definição: A hormone secreted by the adrenal glands that helps regulate blood pressure by controlling sodium and potassium levels in the body.

136.definição: Lots of people have allergies. They're something that your body reacts to, and often include foods and materials that you come into contact with. Usually they are harmless, but for some people they can be much more serious and make them very ill.

141.definição: Pain resulting from something not normally painful, such as a light touch.

144.definição: An autoimmune condition that appears as patchy hair loss on the scalp that may result in permanent hair loss.

151.definição: A perception of something that is not really there.

157.definição: The vehicle that brings you to and from hospital. There are two types – one is an emergency response vehicle, which contain all the equipment to look after you immediately after an accident. The other type does not contain so much equipment but takes you to and from hospital appointments.

168.definição: An enzyme secreted by the pancreas that breaks starch into sugar.

220.definição: Swelling of the main blood vessel leaving the heart (aorta), usually representing an underlying weakness in the wall of the aorta at that location.

228.definição: The external opening at the end of digestive tract where feces are expelled.

243.definição: The muscle opposing the major muscle required to do a task. It works to help balance movement and ward off injury.

268.definição: Bacteria (germs) can sometimes make you ill and sometimes you need antibiotics to treat it. Antibiotics are medicines that attack bacteria that are making you feel unwell. Although they hurt the bacteria, they won't hurt you. Antibiotics don’t work again other infections from viruses or fungi.

475.definição: A term encompassing a variety of conditions in which artery walls thicken and become less flexible. Sometimes called hardening of the arteries. Arteriosclerosis occurs when cholesterol-rich plaque forms on the inner lining of arteries (atherosclerosis), when artery walls become calcified, or when high blood pressure thickens the muscular wall of arteries.

Your endocrine system includes eight major glands throughout your body, such as the thyroid gland, pituitary gland, adrenal gland, and pancreas.

5347.definição: Your genes are what makes you like your parents. Each cell in your body contains about 50,000 different genes. Each gene tells a particular cell how to work, so if you have a genetic problem, this could mean that certain cells don’t work properly.

5350.definição: The branch of science that deals with how you inherit physical and behavioural characteristics, including medical conditions. Genes are what make you like your parents. They decide what colour your hair is, how tall you are and even what you sound like. They're like computer data that's carried on DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and decoded by your body.

5362.definição: A physician who specializes in the care of older patients.

5390.definição: This is when a person cannot hear – either completely or partly. Hearing aids can help some people with deafness, or cochlear implants are used for some people. Deaf people often communicate using a sign language called BSL (British Sign Language).

5394.definicao: The annual reward and incentive programme that measures the achievements of GP practices. Abbreviated to QOF.

5395.definicao: A disease or condition that is highly infectious or dangerous or rapidly progressing.

5398.definicao: A non-surgical technique using an electromagnetic current to penetrate deep into the body’s tissues, which can be used to treat pain, cancer, and heart rhythm disorders, among other conditions.

5399.definicao: Lots of people have allergies. They're something that your body reacts to, and often include foods and materials that you come into contact with. Usually they are harmless, but for some people they can be much more serious and make them very ill.

5400.definicao: Age-related hearing loss caused by the death of hair cells in the inner ear.

5401.definicao: A stringy protein that is the primary component of a blood clot.

5402.definicao: Your bladder is a bag made of muscle, which holds urine (wee) until you go to the toilet.. The amount of urine the bladder holds varies from person to person – some people's bladders can hold a lot of urine, other people's don't hold as much.

5404.definicao: Hard, dense tissue that forms the outer shell of bones. Also called compact bone.

5406.definicao: Anything that is in your body, either inside or in one of the openings, that shouldn’t be there is called a foreign body. Choking is usually caused by a foreign body. You should never try to remove a foreign body yourself – this is a job for experts!

5408.definicao: Having to do with blood vessels and circulation.

5409.definicao: Inflammation of the thyroid gland. Types of thyroiditis include Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, subacute thyroiditis, and postpartum or silent thyroiditis.

sinonimos: chronic fatigue and immune dysfunction syndrome

5411.definicao: So-called bad cholesterol. If there is too much LDL in the blood, it can collect on artery walls, narrowing them and making heart attacks and strokes more likely.

5412.definicao: Another name for German measles, an infectious disease that mainly affects children. Most children are immunised against rubella now, by the MMR jab, but children who have not been immunised are at risk. If a pregnant woman develops rubella, the baby can be born deaf and blind.

5413.definicao: The end stage in the life of a cell when the cell can no longer divide.

5415.definicao: Health insurance policies that fill in the holes in Medicare coverage.

5417.definicao: A condition that deforms the hand, causing fingers to curl toward the palm.

5418.definicao: Intense, long-lasting burning pain usually caused by damage to a peripheral nerve.

5419.definicao: The part of the nervous system that controls involuntary actions, such as blood pressure or breathing. It also plays an important role in the fight or flight response to danger.

5420.definicao: Abbreviation for bone mineral density, the amount of mineralized bone tissue in a given area.

5431.definicao: The process of putting a bone or other body part under a pulling tension by applying weights and pulleys to help healing.

5438.definicao: A blood or urine test that helps doctors determine if the kidneys are working properly.

5439.definicao: The study of making pictures using radioactive materials, like x-rays.

5447.definicao: Computerized x-rays that provide detailed views of the body and brain. Also known as a computed tomography (CT) scan.

The balloon is then inflated to widen the narrowed area. A stent may be put in place to hold the artery open. Percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty is also known as balloon angioplasty.

5462.definicao: The layer of tooth material that covers the root.

5468.definicao: One of the muscles that forms frown lines on the forehead.

5469.definicao: Your foot is made up of 26 bones by the time you’re an adult and the largest one is your heel bone. Your feet are important because they help you stand and walk upright and they’re also vital for walking.

5471.definicao: A treatment that destroys tumors with heat generated by ultrasound energy.

5501.definicao: Tiny yellow deposits in the retina of the eye.

5505.definicao: Something that cause an allergic reaction.

5509.definicao: A tumor that is not cancer; usually found in the breast.

5510.definicao: The study of the heart and how it works. The specialist doctor who looks after your heart is called your cardiologist.

5516.definicao: Shortening of a muscle, usually because of disease or lack of use, that limits joint movement.

5517.definicao: Feeling sick, or wanting to puke, isn't very nice. Nausea is the word that doctors sometimes use to say this.

5518.definicao: The region in the back of the brain responsible for visual processing.

5523.definicao: A device that delivers a specific dose of an inhaled asthma medication.

5525.definicao: A procedure that uses radio waves to heat and destroy cells in the prostate gland that are obstructing the urethra.

5527.definicao: A tumor that is not cancer, which is found in the uterus.

5529.definicao: A person who receives treatment at a hospital or other medical facility but does not stay overnight.

5532.definicao: An inflammatory disease resulting from excess sebum production, follicle plugging, and increased bacterial production.

5533.definicao: A way of feeding where feed goes directly into a tube in your stomach bypassing your mouth and throat.

5537.definicao: A small organic molecule, often made from B vitamins, that helps enzymes function in the body.

5538.definicao: Sponge-like tissue in the penis that fills with blood during sexual arousal, causing an erection.

5539.definicao: A professional trained to evaluate driving skills and, when appropriate, suggest equipment and adaptations to make driving safer for people with certain physical or mental limitations.

5541.definicao: Blood sugar levels that are higher than normal, but not yet high enough for a diagnosis of diabetes.

5542.definicao: Proteins made by the body to protect against viruses, bacteria, and other harmful agents.

5546.definicao: A general feeling of illness that can be a sign of disease.

5547.definicao: A flexible, stretchy protein found in skin and connective tissue.

5554.definicao: A severe and sometimes deadly inflammation of the brain that can be caused by a number of different viruses.

5561.definicao: Bony bumps found on the finger joints in some people with osteoarthritis.

5563.definicao: The smallest part of a substance.

5565.definicao: A loss of brain function that worsens over time and affects memory, thinking, behavior, and language.

5566.definicao: A brain disorder that causes movement problems, including shaking, difficulty walking, and rigidity in muscles.

5567.definicao: Pain and stiffness of soft tissues in and around joints.

5568.definicao: Cells in the retina that are sensitive to color and light.

5569.definicao: This is when a person cannot hear – either completely or partly. Hearing aids can help some people with deafness, or cochlear implants are used for some people. Deaf people often communicate using a sign language called BSL (British Sign Language).

5570.definicao: Any of a group of male sex hormones, including testosterone, that controls male characteristics such as beard growth.

5571.definicao: Medication that stifles the body's immune response; often given after an organ transplant to prevent rejection of the new organ.

5572.definicao: The discharge or release of a substance, usually a fluid.

5573.definicao: A planned, often group, meeting with a person with addiction, with the aim of overcoming denial and inducing the individual to seek treatment.

5574.definicao: A machine that helps people get more air into their lungs when sleeping by increasing the pressure or force of air when breathing in; often used to treat sleep apnea.

Traduções.pt: pressão positiva de dois níveis nas vias aéreas *
Traduções.es: presión positiva de dos niveles en las vías respiratorias *

5575.definicao: Fats, oils, and waxes that serve as building blocks for cells or as energy sources. Lipids are also capable of accumulating in the artery walls to form plaque.

5576.definicao: The lower portion of the spine. It includes the five lowermost bones (vertebrae) of the spine and is the start of the lower back.

5577.definicao: Using wires, catheters, balloons, stents and devices to treat arterial disease in a minimally invasive way.

5578.definicao: An adverse reaction that may have similar symptoms to an allergic reaction but does not engage the immune system, and thus is not an allergy.

5579.definicao: Compounds such as lycopene and beta carotene that give red, yellow, and orange color to certain plants.

5580.definicao: Medications or other substances that prevent blood cells called platelets from clustering and forming blood clots.

5581.definicao: Pertaining to the heart and lungs.

5582.definicao: White blood cells that come from bone marrow, and produce antibodies to fight off disease.

5583.definicao: A system that controls many hormonal activities in the body, including the stress response. Often called the HPA axis.

5584.definicao: Pertaining to something that is poisonous.

5585.definicao: A buildup of fat on the inside of a blood vessel that interferes with blood flow.

5586.definicao: Diagnostic procedure that uses a combination of large magnets, radiofrequencies, and a computer to produce detailed images of organs and structures within the body.

5587.definicao: A process in which bone heals around an implant to create a stable anchor.

5588.definicao: Abnormal connections between veins and arteries, usually caused by a birth defect.

5589.definicao: A group of blood tests performed before and during a pregnancy.

5590.definicao: Magnetic resonance imaging. Abbreviation for magnetic resonance imaging--a scan that creates detailed pictures of internal organs. MRIs use radio waves, a strong magnetic field, and a computer to produce images of organs and internal tissues.

5591.definicao: Heart disease caused by a lack of selenium, an element that the body needs to function properly.

5592.definicao: The thin layer of smooth muscle lining of the colon or rectum.

5593.definicao: Care provided by GP practices, dental practices, community pharmacies and high street optometrists. It is many people's first (primary) point of contact with the NHS. Around 90% of patient interaction is with primary care services.

5594.definicao: One of the main arteries that supplies blood to the heart; it curves around the back of the heart.

5595.definicao: A trained medical professional who helps families who are caring for older adults.

5596.definicao: This is a thick, slimy fluid released by the mucous membranes.

5597.definicao: A fasting blood sugar level above a healthy level, but still below the level used to diagnose diabetes. An individual with prediabetes is at increased risk for developing diabetes.

5598.definicao: The medical term for high blood pressure. Hypertension is a major risk factor for stroke, especially hemorrhagic and lacunar strokes, because it puts excess stress on the walls of blood vessels and damages their delicate inner lining.

5599.definicao: An inflammatory autoimmune disease that typically attacks the connective tissue of the joints, causing them to become painful, inflamed, and sometimes deformed.

5600.definicao: The abnormal narrowing of a hollow passage in the body, such as the esophagus or the urethra.

5601.definicao: A group of eight tests used as a general screening tool.

5602.definicao: A substance that causes the gallbladder to squeeze, increasing the discharge of bile.

5603.definicao: A thrombolytic (clot-dissolving) agent designed to dissolve the blood clots that block an artery during a heart attack or stroke.

5604.definicao: Red blood cells carry oxygen from your lungs to cells around your body.

Traduções.es: las células rojas de la sangre *

5605.definicao: Break in the heart muscle that allows blood to escape into the pericardial sac.

5606.definicao: When the genetic trait carried by one allele of a gene pair eclipses the trait carried by another; for example, when a gene carries alleles for two different eye colors, the dominant eye color gene determines the person’s eye color.do-not-resuscitate orderA legal document that tells health professionals not to revive a person if his or her heart or breathing stops. Commonly referred to as a DNR.

5607.definicao: Abbreviation for peripheral artery disease, a condition caused by atherosclerosis in the arteries in the legs or leading to them.

5608.definicao: A condition characterized by excessive and often compulsive substance use, impaired control over substance use, continued use of substances despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms that emerge when the substance use is discontinued.

5609.definicao: The process by which bacteria destroy tooth enamel.

5610.definicao: The period in a woman's life lasting from the end of perimenopause until the end of life.

5611.definicao: A legal form allowing a person to appoint someone else to make their medical decisions. Also known as a durable power of attorney for health care.

5612.definicao: A curved, bowl-shaped depression in the outer part of the hipbone. The ball-shaped portion at the top of the thighbone fits into this space to form the hip joint.

5613.definicao: A group of inflammatory hair disorders that can cause irreversible damage to the follicle that results in permanent hair loss and scarring. Also known as scarring alopecia.

5614.definicao: An inflammation of the plantar fascia; the leading cause of heel pain.

5615.definicao: A condition caused by excess fluid accumulating in the lungs, making breathing difficult.

5616.definicao: A state of lethargy and unresponsiveness.

5617.definicao: A type of medication taken to treat type 2 diabetes.

5618.definicao: Two iodine-containing hormones called thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3). They help regulate the body's metabolism and calcium balance.

5619.definicao: Germs cause diseases. There are different types of germ, including viruses and bacteria.

5620.definicao: Abbreviation for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, a combination of chest compressions and mouth-to-mouth breathing that keep oxygenated blood circulating to the brain and tissues.

5621.definicao: An outside factor that has an effect on a person’s environment or well-being.

5622.definicao: An inflammation of the hair follicle.

5624.definicao: The lever-like backward projection extending off each vertebra, to which muscles and ligaments are attached.

5625.definicao: A substance that kills or slows the growth of bacteria.

5626.definicao: A copy of a brand-name drug whose patent has expired. These drugs are less expensive than brand-name drugs.

5627.definicao: Powerful tranquilizing drugs used to treat schizophrenia and, sometimes, severe nausea.

5628.definicao: A specialized organ of the immune system located in the upper-middle chest where T cells mature.

5629.definicao: Your hip is the joint between your pelvis and your thighbone. It’s a ‘ball and socket’ joint which means you can move your leg in all directions.

5630.definicao: A thrombolytic (clot-dissolving) drug made using recombinant DNA technology; used to dissolve blood clots causing an ischemic stroke, pulmonary embolism, or myocardial infarction.

5631.definicao: An enzyme that helps blood cells known as platelets stick to each other, a key step in the formation of a blood clot.

5632.definicao: Cells that can ingest other cells, bacteria, and foreign particles.

5633.definicao: A measure of body fat estimated from a person’s height and weight. A healthy BMI is defined as 18.5 to 24.9. BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. Using English units, multiply weight in pounds by 703, then divide the result by height in inches, and divide that result by height in inches.

5634.definicao: A technique used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) that allows the surgeon to view the prostate directly while it is being shrunk by a laser beam.

5635.definicao: Any painkilling drug such as morphine or codeine derived from the opium poppy.

5636.definicao: Any disease caused by bacteria, viruses, or other pathogens that is spread from person to person.

5637.definicao: Usually abbreviated as AIDS. This is the most advanced stage of infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), which can severely weaken the immune system. People with AIDS get many infections, often from diseases that don’t affect people with healthy immune systems.

5638.definicao: The vehicle that brings you to and from hospital. There are two types – one is an emergency response vehicle, which contain all the equipment to look after you immediately after an accident. The other type does not contain so much equipment but takes you to and from hospital appointments.

5639.definicao: Long-term, severe pain that doesn’t spring from an injury or illness, that interferes with daily life, and is often accompanied by other problems, such as depression, irritability, and anxiety.

5640.definicao: A common condition in babies and young children resulting in narrowing and inflammation of the airways that causes hoarseness, noisy breathing and a cough. It is usually viral.

5641.definicao: A false or irrational belief held by a person despite evidence to the contrary.

5642.definicao: The bony socket that holds the eyeball.

5643.definicao: A test that shows the amount of certain gases, like oxygen and carbon dioxide, are in your blood. It’s usually used to check whether you’re breathing effectively and getting enough oxygen.

5644.definicao: Thin, gelatinous ligaments that attach the lens to the ciliary body and support the lens centrally behind the pupil.

5645.definicao: Treatment given in a large regional hospital that provides highly specialised care, for example in cardiac surgery or oncology.

5646.definicao: One of two types of tissue that form bone; this type is commonly found at the center of long bones and makes up a large part of the hip and spine. Also known as trabecular bone.

5647.definicao: Use of extreme cold to freeze and destroy diseased tissue.

5648.definicao: An area where two bones meet that is fixed, or doesn’t move.

5649.definicao: A wall or other structure that divides one cavity from another. For example, in the heart the muscular septum separates the right side of the heart from the left side.

5650.definicao: Synonymous with epidemic. Sometimes used to refer to a local epidemic as compared to a larger, general epidemic.

5651.definicao: A substance produced by the body to stimulate tissue growth.

5652.definicao: A legal document that describes the kind of medical care a person want if an accident or illness leaves him or her unable to make or communicate decisions.

Traduções.pt: diretiva antecipada de cuidados (ou diretiva médica antecipada) *
Traduções.es: directiva anticipada de atención (o directiva médica anticipada) *
Traduções.en: advance care directive (or advance medical directive)

5652.Termo: advance care directive (or advance medical directive)

5653.definicao: Abbreviation for post-traumatic stress disorder, a prolonged reaction to a traumatic event. PTSD can cause crippling anxiety and leading to other problems, such as sleep disturbances, depression, and substance abuse.

5654.definicao: The bony shell that surrounds the inner ear.

5655.definicao: This is the space inside a tube. In medicine, it's usually used to refer to the inside of a tubular organ, like your intestines, or the inside of a tube to give medicine, like a central line.

5656.definicao: The administration of drugs or other fluids into the body by any route except via the gastrointestinal tract (for example by intravenous or intramuscular injection or infusion).

5657.definicao: A hole created through the front of the neck and into the windpipe (trachea). It provides an air passage when the usual route for breathing is obstructed, such as after a traumatic injury to the face or neck, or when long-term use of a breathing machine (ventilator) is needed.

5658.definicao: A heat therapy for benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate gland) that uses microwaves to destroy prostate tissue that obstructs urine flow.

5659.definicao: Relating to or near the lower back between the ribs and the hipbones.

5660.definicao: Molecules that help protect the body from foreign substances. These molecules display proteins on the surface of cells so that protective immune system cells can kill the protein if it is harmful to the body.

Traduções.pt: molécula do complexo principal de histocompatibilidade *
Traduções.es: molécula del complejo mayor de histocompatibilidad *

5661.definicao: This is a special X-ray picture of an artery - that's the vessel that takes blood from your heart to the rest of your body.

5662.definicao: Proteins in the body that act as messengers between immune system cells.

5663.definicao: A helper treatment given before a primary treatment is started, such as when chemotherapy is done before surgery in order to shrink a tumor.

5664.definicao: How quickly and completely the body can absorb and use a nutrient.

5665.definicao: An older term for heart failure, a disorder caused by a decrease in the heart’s ability to pump blood. Congestive heart failure referred specifically to the type of heart failure associated with the accumulation of excess fluid in the lungs or extremities.

5666.definicao: A narrowed area in the aorta (the main artery that leaves the heart) present from birth.

5667.definicao: The so-called master gland, located at the base of the brain. It controls and regulates the thyroid and other glands throughout the endocrine system.

5669.definicao: A channel in the root of the tooth that contains the pulp.

5670.definicao: Blockage of one or more arteries in the lungs by a blood clot that formed elsewhere, often in the legs. Typically accompanied by sudden shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough.

5671.definicao: A substance that soothes irritated tissues and mucous membranes.

5672.definicao: An extract made of dried animal thyroid glands.

5673.definicao: Nerve damage and resulting loss of sensation, movement, or other function.

5674.definicao: Pain caused by irritation of a nerve as it exits the spinal cord.

5675.definicao: A device to assess lung function, often used to diagnose and monitor asthma.

5676.definicao: The inability to get or maintain an erection sufficient for intercourse. Sometimes referred to as ED.

5677.definicao: Short-lived radioactive chemicals that are used in nuclear imaging tests.

5678.definicao: A disease in which the body’s immune system prevents the thyroid gland from producing enough thyroid hormone.

5679.definicao: The substance found in the nucleus of cells that contains the genetic instructions for that living organism.

5680.definicao: A substance that speeds up chemical reactions inside cells and provides a boost of energy. Examples include caffeine and amphetamine.

5681.definicao: Being able to breathe is very important but asthma can sometimes make it more difficult. If you have asthma, running about or eating certain foods can irritate your airways and make it harder for you to breathe. An inhaler is a special gadget that sprays medicine into your mouth. It help you to relax and breathe more easily. A nebuliser delivers medicines into your lungs in a form that you breathe.

5682.definicao: Live-in facilities for adults who need help with certain things, but do not need round-the-clock care. They provide residents with supervision and certain services, such as meals, transportation, or help with dressing, grooming, and other daily activities.

5683.definicao: A site on the surface of some cells to which estrogen molecules attach.

5684.definicao: Sometimes, when you've been sick, it can be difficult doing things like you used to. An occupational therapist is someone who will help you to get used to doing everyday things again - such as doing up your laces or getting on with your schoolwork.

5685.definicao: A method of shrivelling up blood vessels by injecting a medicine.

5686.definicao: A chemical solution applied to the skin to cause it to blister and peel, revealing a new layer of skin; treatment is used to improve the appearance of the skin, reducing lines, wrinkles, age spots, and other problems.

5687.definicao: A feature of many clinical trials in which participants are randomly assigned to either a group to be tested or a control group.

5688.definicao: Substances that provide energy and that the body needs for growth. The main categories arefat, carbohydrate, and protein.

5689.definicao: A substance that the body can convert into the active form of a vitamin. One example is beta carotene, which the body can convert into vitamin A as needed.

5690.definicao: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is a virus that attacks the immune system, making it difficult for the body to fight infection and disease. Abbreviation for human immunodeficiency virus, the virus that leads to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). HIV damages immune cells so that they are no longer able to fight off other infections.

5691.definicao: A hormone released by the pituitary gland that stimulates the production of eggs in women and sperm in men.

5692.definicao: One of the small, shock-absorbing cushions located between the vertebrae of the spine.

5693.definicao: A condition that occurs when an internal organ slips from its normal position.

5694.definicao: A period of time (often 6-12 weeks) spent away from a medical degree on a placement, often overseas. A wide range of other health-related degree courses can also include an elective, such as dentistry, nursing, physiotherapy and pharmacy. When you have a test or operation planned for the future, the doctors may call it an ‘elective’ test or operation. This just means that it’s not an emergency and that it is planned to happen at some point in the future.

5695.definicao: A genetic condition in which the body absorbs and stores too much iron.

5696.definicao: Examination of the airways using a bronchoscope (a flexible or rigid tube with a small camera and light at the end). A test where the doctor can look inside your lungs using a flexible tube with a camera and light on the end. You’ll usually have this test under a general anaesthetic, so you won’t know what is happening.

5697.definicao: A condition in which the walls of the small blood vessels in the retina leak serum and tiny pockets of swelling form in the walls of blood vessels. Also called background retinopathy.

5698.definicao: The brain region responsible for the comprehension of speech.

5699.definicao: The abbreviation for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

5700.definicao: A drug used to treat high blood pressure and congestive heart failure. These drugs stop the production of angiotensin II. This lowers blood pressure and reduces the heart's workload. Usually abbreviated as ACE inhibitor.

Traduções.pt: inibidor da enzima conversora de angiotensina *
Traduções.es: inhibidor de la enzima convertidora de angiotensina *

5701.definicao: This is an abnormal connection (or hole) that happens between an organ, vessel, skin or intestine. They can occur as a result of injury, surgery or infection.

5702.definicao: A register providing public assurance for the provision of a competent workforce that contributes to a high quality public health service. Abbreviated to UKPHR.

Traduções.pt: registro de saúde pública do reino unido *
Traduções.es: registro de salud pública del reino unido *

5703.definicao: Affecting both sides of the body. For example, bilateral breast cancer is cancer occurring in both breasts at the same time.

5704.definicao: A substance that binds to amyloid proteins in the brain (markers for Alzheimer’s disease), making them visible under positron emission tomography (PET) scanning.

5705.definicao: A type of birthmark which is the colour of milky coffee, hence the name.

5706.definicao: The process by which a change occurs in genetic material and is inherited by the next generation.

5707.definicao: A pharmacy that mixes custom medications for patients and doctors.

5708.definicao: A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart and to various parts of the body.

5709.definicao: Able to walk; not confined to a bed.
pt: Passeio, galeria, cor-redor, ambulatorial, refere–se a paciente  que pode caminhar/andar

5710.definicao: A person who can make a choice and be satisfied with it when presented with an option that meets his or her standards, without needing to examine all options or find the absolute best.

5711.definicao: A group of tissues in the body that provide internal support and bind other tissues in the body, including bone, cartilage, tendons, and ligaments.

5712.definicao: The product formed by the attachment of glucose (blood sugar) to hemoglobin (the oxygen-carrying protein in red blood cells). Usually referred to as hemoglobin A1c, or HbA1c.

5713.definicao: Sometimes the doctors need to be able to get inside your body to make you sort out problems that you're experiencing. Most operations are carried out under an anaesthetic, which means you won't be awake or know what is happening.

5714.definicao: Surgery that uses a laser to seal off blood vessels in the eye; used to treat a number of eye diseases.

5715.definicao: Temporary chest pain that occurs when the heart isn’t getting enough oxygen and blood, usually occurring in response to physical activity or stress.

5716.definicao: A waxy, fat-like substance produced by the liver and found in all food from animal sources; an essential component of body cells and a precursor of bile acids and some hormones.

5717.definicao: A disorder marked by heavy snoring and interrupted breathing during sleep. It increases the risk of developing high blood pressure and having a stroke and is more common in people who are obese.

5718.definicao: One of two types of major thyroid hormone manufactured by the thyroid gland. It contains four iodine atoms. Also known as T4.

5719.definicao: Connective tissue in the foot which joins the heel bone to the ball of the foot.

5720.definicao: The medical word for your collarbone – the ridge you can feel from your shoulders to in front of your neck.

5721.definicao: An itchy condition of the scalp caused by a fungal infection. Also known as ringworm.

5722.definicao: An enlargement of the thyroid gland with more than one lump or nodule appearing on the neck.

5723.definicao: A consultant is a senior doctor who has had lots of training and has extra knowledge about one type of illness or treatment.

5724.definicao: The period of time before a baby is born. For instance, antenatal screening is used to find out if the baby is alright before it is born.

5725.definicao: Steps taken to prevent a particular disease or condition, such as taking nitroglycerin to prevent angina.

5726.definicao: An overgrowth of abnormally shaped cells in areas of the breast that produce milk (lobules). atypical lobular hyperplasia is not cancerous but may become cancer.

5727.definicao: An accumulation of mucus or of blood in an organ.

5728.definicao: A type of short-term memory process that involves temporarily storing and manipulating information.

5729.definicao: The large bone of the calf, or shinbone.

5730.definicao: Healthy dietary fats from plant sources such as vegetable oils, nuts, and whole grains, as well as from fatty fish. Includes monounsaturated fat and polyunsaturated fat.

5731.definicao: Uncontrollable contraction or spasm of a blood vessel.

5732.definicao: Cells located deep in the epidermis that produce melanin, the pigment that colors skin.

5733.definicao: Something that prevents infection. You can get antiseptic mouthwash, antiseptic cream, and antiseptic hand wipes, all of which prevent infection.

5734.definicao: A man-made version of the thyroid hormone thyroxine.

5735.definicao: Learn about HonorHealth's quality of care.

5737.definicao: A test to measure the clotting tendency of blood.

5738.definicao: Estrogen combined with progestogen, prescribed to augment a woman’s depleted hormones during menopause.

5739.definicao: A type of diabetes, a chronic condition that affects the way the body's tissues use sugar (glucose), their main source of fuel. Once called juvenile-onset diabetes and insulin-dependent diabetes. People with this form of diabetes don't make enough insulin, a hormone that controls the movement of glucose into cells. They must rely on insulin injections.

5740.definicao: An herbal product or tea made by boiling a plant in water.

5741.definicao: A diagnostic test in which cardiovascular measurements such as heart rate, blood pressure, and electrical activity are recorded while the heart is being stressed (usually by having the person exercise on a treadmill or bicycle).

5742.definicao: A progressive brain disease that causes memory loss, impaired thinking, and personality changes.

5743.definicao: The hard outside layer of tooth material.

5744.definicao: A common, over-the-counter drug used to reduce fever and relieve mild to moderate pain, but which does not reduce redness or swelling (inflammation).

5745.definicao: Relating to all or some of the organs of the digestive tract, from the mouth to the anus.

5746.definicao: Abnormal heart rhythm that starts in the lower chambers of the heart; this rhythm disturbance can occur as a complication of a heart attack and impairs the heart's pumping ability.

5747.definicao: A destructive change in brain tissue, such as a wound, injury or inflammation.

5748.definicao: The note that a doctor writes to a pharmacist to tell them what medicines you need and in what dose.

5749.definicao: A complete hearing test that involves listening to sounds of different frequencies and volume.

5750.definicao: A medical doctor trained to diagnose and treat disorders involving inflammation of the joints and other parts of the musculoskeletal system.

5751.definicao: Prostate cancer that no longer responds to hormone therapy.

Traduções.pt: câncer de próstata independente de andrógeno *
Traduções.es: cáncer de próstata independiente de andrógenos *

5754.definicao: Any one of over 100 disorders that cause inflammation in connective tissues.

5755.definicao: Your hands are really important – they help you hold things, grip things tight and also do small fiddly tasks too. What makes us different from animals is that we have something called ‘opposable thumbs’, which means that we can touch our thumb and fingers together to hold things. Like your foot, your hand is made up of lots of small bones.

5757.definicao: Physiological changes, such as quickened breathing and heartbeat and increased blood pressure, brought on by stress hormones released in response to a real or perceived threat to safety. Also called the fight-or-flight response.

5758.definicao: A complication of diabetes that occurs when the small blood vessels in the retina are damaged. It can impair vision or even lead to blindness.

5759.definicao: A junction in the body where bones are linked together.

5760.definicao: A hormone produced by adrenal glands that puts the body on heightened alert when a threat is perceived (the fight-or-flight response). Also known as noradrenaline.

5761.definicao: A standing or seated position in which the chin is parallel to the floor; the shoulders, hips, and knees are at even heights; and the knees and feet point straight ahead.

5762.definicao: This is when the heart doesn’t beat in a regular way – some people have this all the time, and they need something called a pacemaker to make the heart beat regularly.

5763.definicao: A research method that looks for possible causes for a current disease by examining a study population's past habits.

5764.definicao: This is where a baby is born with a split in the roof of their mouth. It happened while the baby was developing in the womb and can be fixed in an operation. Sometimes a baby can have both a cleft lip and a cleft palate.

5765.definicao: Chemicals found in fruits, vegetables, wine, and tea that may protect cells from damage and have health benefits.

5766.definicao: Devices worn in shoes either to change the way the foot works while walking or to provide support. They are used to help pain outside the foot such as in the ankle, knee, hip or back.

5767.definicao: A method of keeping part of your body in one place while it heals. For instance, if you break a finger, it may be splinted to the next finger to keep it in one place so you can’t bend it until it heals.

5768.definicao: A health care professional licensed to examine the eye, and diagnose and treat some eye diseases.

5769.definicao: Light-sensitive cells in the retina that respond best in darkness and dim light.

5770.definicao: A unit of measurement for the loudness of a sound. The highest decibels indicate the loudest sounds.

5771.definicao: A severe headache preceded by visual disturbances such as flashing lights, seeing lines, or a blind spot.

5773.definicao: Swelling caused by abnormal accumulation of fluid in tissues.

5774.definicao: The airways that connect the lungs to the trachea (windpipe) and allow air to pass into and out of the lungs.

5775.definicao: The cycle that the feet and legs make when walking, beginning when one heel hits the ground and ending when the same heel hits the ground again.

5776.definicao: A test to measure sleepiness during the day. A tester measures how long it takes a person who is sitting up in a chair or bed to fall asleep after he or she has been asked to stay awake.

Traduções.es: prueba de mantenimiento de la vigilia *

5777.definicao: A test that uses a special dye and X-rays to detect spinal cord problems. The dye is injected into the space surrounding the spinal cord, making the spinal cord, spinal canal, and nerve roots appear in detail on the X-ray.

5778.definicao: An instrument with a light and mirrors for examining the deep interior of the eye.

5779.definicao: A cell that is embedded in fully formed bone.

5780.definicao: Relating to or near the small of the back and the back part of the pelvis between the hips.

5781.definicao: A problem with any area of a person’s sexual response that causes distress.

5782.definicao: Any disease in which the organs or tissues in the body are damaged progressively over time.

5783.definicao: Means crooked or bent; refers to stiffening of a joint.

The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

6737.definicao: Creatine phosphokinase: an enzyme present in various tissue types.

6738.definicao: A muscle cramp, usually felt in the calf, caused by poor blood flow to the legs.

6739.definicao: A collection of pus, which usually happens as a result of an infection. Pus is made up of old white blood cells and broken down tissue cells. Abscesses can be very painful and may need to be drained.

6740.definicao: Surgical removal of all or part of the breast.

6741.definicao: A decongestant drug used to treat nasal congestion and sometimes mild incontinence.

6742.definicao: When an eyelid, usually the lower one, flips outward so that the inner surface is exposed.

6743.definicao: The process of reviving a person who is not breathing or whose heart is not beating using techniques such as artificial respiration and heart massage.

6744.definicao: This is part of your digestive system. You have a large intestine (also called the colon) and a small intestine (duodenum, jejunum and ileum). They work together to squeeze food through to your bottom, absorbing liquid and goodness along the way.

6745.definicao: An antioxidant chemical found in certain plants, like soybeans.

6747.definicao: An anticoagulant drug that prevents blood clotting; people taking it must have regular blood tests to determine that their blood does not clot too readily or too slowly.

6748.definicao: Relating to the peritoneum, or the lining of the abdominal cavity.

6749.definicao: An treatment that helps people learn to gain control over normally unconscious body functions, such as breathing and heart rates.

6750.definicao: A tooth or implant to which a fixed prosthesis is anchored.

6751.definicao: The section of the small intestine between the duodenum and the ileum.

6752.definicao: A lifelong condition that significantly affects how someone understands what is said to them and /or how they express themselves

6753.definicao: Abbreviation for transient ischemic attack, a brain attack that resolves on its own within 24 hours. Sometimes called a mini-stroke, a TIA is often an early warning sign of an impending stroke.

6754.definicao: Computerised tomography scan. Uses X-rays and a computer to create detailed images of the inside of the body. Sometimes referred to as a CAT scan or computed tomography scan.

6755.definicao: An endocrinologist is a doctor who cares for children who have difficulties with their hormones.

6756.definicao: This is when a substance is put into your body using a needle. There are different types of injection – including intravenous (into a vein), intramuscular (into a muscle), intrathecal (into the fluid around your spinal cord) and subcutaneous (under the skin).

6757.definicao: Part of the body that produces and excretes urine. It consists of the kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra.

6758.definicao: The component of thinking that organizes, plans, decides, and inhibits inappropriate impulses.

6759.definicao: Diagnostic procedure that uses a combination of a large magnet, radiofrequencies and a computer to produce detailed images of the blood vessels.

6760.definicao: Loss of brain function, common among former boxers, caused by repeated blows to the head.

6761.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down milk sugar (lactose) in the body.

6762.definicao: A skin condition that enlarges blood vessels in the face, causing redness of the nose and other parts of the face.

6763.definicao: An electrocardiogram (EKG) tracing taken in a healthy individual for later comparison to subsequent EKGs.

6764.definicao: Pertaining to the period after giving birth.

6765.definicao: A study that tests a therapy in humans, rather than in laboratories or on animals.

6766.definicao: A rare disease in which a person can’t recognize objects, shapes, or people. Often due to a brain or neurological condition.

6767.definicao: An advanced stage of gum disease that attacks the teeth’s supporting structures.

6768.definicao: Abbreviation for ventricular septal defect—one or more holes in the septum, the muscular wall separating the right and left sides of the heart.

6769.definicao: The name of a dentist who specialises in straightening or moving teeth.

6770.definicao: A type of dementia caused when blood flow is interrupted to the white matter of the brain, which lies beneath the cerebral cortex.

6771.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down collagen.

6772.definicao: A protein that helps muscle contract and relax.

6773.definicao: One or more holes in the septum, the muscular wall separating the right and left sides of the heart.

6774.definicao: A test that let the doctor look at the inside of part of your body. There are lots of different types of test, like a gastroscopy which involves your stomach and a cystoscopy which involves your bladder.

6775.definicao: A natural compound found in soybeans that may help prevent cancer from spreading. It is a type of flavonoid.

6776.definicao: A tool that uses sound waves to reveal blood flow problems.

6777.definicao: Another term for alcohol dependenceA chronic, progressive disease characterized by excessive and often compulsive drinking, impaired control over drinking, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol use is discontinued. Also known as alcoholism.

6778.definicao: It's a type of brain disorder where your brain 'short circuits' so the electrical messages travelling to and from the brain are disrupted.

6779.definicao: A thin tube that is inserted into the body to provide or drain fluids, or to carry tiny surgical instruments and cameras in minimally invasive surgeries.

6780.definicao: A hearing aid’s power, measured in the number of decibels that it can add to sound.

6781.definicao: This consists of your oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, small bowel, large bowel, and rectum. Its job is to break down the food you eat so the goodness can be absorbed and get rid of the waste stuff as poo.

6782.definicao: Scarring of some of the tissue inside the penis, causing the penis to bend at an angle during an erection.

6783.definicao: Heavy bouts of drinking interspersed with periods of abstinence; often refers to the consumption of five or more alcoholic beverages within one day.

6784.definicao: The body’s ability to keep blood pressure, temperature, water levels, oxygen levels, and more set at the right levels for cells to survive.

6785.definicao: The transition time in a woman’s life that begins when ovaries produce less estrogen and menstruation becomes less frequent, and ends when the ovaries no longer produce eggs and menstruation stops.

6786.definicao: A way of diagnosing food allergies in which suspected foods are removed from the diet one at a time until the food causing a problem is found.

6787.definicao: An action in which a muscle generates force but does not contract or extend enough to move a joint, such as when pushing against an immovable object.

6788.definicao: An inherited disorder in which the liver overproduces very low-density lipoprotein, causing high levels of cholesterol or triglycerides, or both.

6790.definicao: A rare form of headache. Sufferers experience a severe throbbing, drilling pain on one side of the face or behind the eye.

6791.definicao: Referring to the sacrum, the wedge-shaped bone consisting of five fused vertebrae forming the posterior part of the pelvis.

6792.definicao: Arthritis caused by harmful organisms such as bacteria.

6793.definicao: An abnormally fast heartbeat originating in heart tissue above the ventricles.

6794.definicao: Narrowing of blood vessels that supply blood to the legs, arms, stomach, or kidneys.

6795.definicao: A drug that increases the strength of heart muscle contractions.

6796.definicao: Deepest layer of skin, which consists of connective tissue and fat.

6797.definicao: A medication that opens airways by relaxing the muscles around the airway; used to treat asthma or COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).

6798.definicao: An eye condition in which the retina (the macula) becomes swollen with fluid.

6799.definicao: The middle layer and main structure of the hair shaft, consisting mainly of compact bundles of the protein keratin.

6800.definicao: A collection of birth defects resulting from exposure of the fetus to alcohol during pregnancy.

6801.definicao: Live microorganisms used to benefit health, such as the L. acidophilus bacteria found in yogurt.

6802.definicao: Restoration of blood flow to areas of heart muscle affected by coronary artery disease by means of coronary artery bypass surgery or angioplasty.

6803.definicao: Cholesterol-lowering medications that interfere with the enzyme 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase; also known as HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors. Statins work by changing the way the liver processes lipids.

6804.definicao: A system that incorporates processes to minimise all risks in an organisation.

6805.definicao: Coughing up or spitting up blood from the lungs.

6806.definicao: Technologies that allow doctors to view the structure of the brain or see how different parts of the brain function; examples include computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), functional MRI (fMRI), and positron emission tomography (PET).

6807.definicao: A procedure to diagnose or treat heart problems; a long, thin, flexible tube is inserted into a blood vessel in the arm, neck, or upper thigh and maneuvered into the heart to evaluate various heart functions.

6808.definicao: The ability of muscle to continue to perform without stopping because of fatigue.

6809.definicao: Puncture of the wall of a body cavity by a hollow needle in order to draw off excess fluid or to obtain diagnostic material (eg abdomen or chest).

6812.definicao: A test that gives moving images of the inside of the body; could be likened to an x-ray movie.

6813.definicao: This is the period where you stay isolated to stop passing on an illness to other people.

6814.definicao: Transplanting tissue from one part of the body to another.

6815.definicao: A sometimes painful condition in which the toe curls up and under (resembling a hammer).

6817.definicao: A hollow chamber into which inhaled medicines can be squirted before inhalation. Spacers are used with metered-dose inhalers to help deliver medicine effectively to the bronchial tubes and to reduce the amount of medicine left behind on the tongue and throat.

6818.definicao: A drug used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate gland. It relieves constriction of the urethra and improves urine flow by relaxing the smooth muscle tissue in the capsule that surrounds the prostate.

6819.definicao: The medical word for your windpipe.

6820.definicao: The swelling of the deeper layers of the skin, caused by a build-up of fluid.

6821.definicao: The administration of different drugs taken together, which increases the likelihood of side effects from drug interactions.

6822.definicao: A tendon joins muscle to bone or muscle to muscle. They very strong and flexible and are made up of lots of fibres joined together.

6824.definicao: A hairline crack in a bone that usually occurs from overuse; left untreated, this may lead to displacement of the bones.

6825.definicao: A mark on the skin that is usually red and sore. It may also be itchy. Rashes happen if you’re allergic to something and goes away quite quickly. A rash can sometimes be a sign of disease too, such as measles.

6826.definicao: A group of early symptoms preceding a given disease or condition. For example, a migraine prodrome (fatigue, hunger, nervousness) may occur hours or days before the headache strikes.

6827.definicao: A brain disorder that causes dementia, neurotic behavior, and gradual changes in personality and emotional control.

6828.definicao: A valve problem in which one or both of the mitral valve flaps collapse backward into the left atrium. This may allow a small amount of blood to leak backward (regurgitate) through the valve.

6829.definicao: A slender piece of material surgically inserted under the urethra or bladder neck to provide support and improve continence.

6830.definicao: Feelings of contentment or joy; the overall experience of pleasure and meaning in life.

6831.definicao: A hormone produced by fat cells that acts on the brain to suppress appetite and burn stored fat.

6832.definicao: A rare disease in which the muscles become weak and stiff and a skin rash appears.

6833.definicao: Blurry vision caused by an irregular curve in the cornea of the eye.

6834.definicao: A test that checks the health of muscles and the nerves that control them.

6835.definicao: One of the main arteries that supplies blood to the heart; it runs down the front surface of the heart.

6836.definicao: The body’s fuel reserves. This substance, stored primarily in the liver and muscles, is later converted into glucose to provide cells with energy.

6837.definicao: The act of bringing up air from the stomach through the mouth with a characteristic sound. Commonly known as belching.

6838.definicao: A cylinder of soft tissue surrounding a man’s urethra and running the length of the penis.

6839.definicao: A condition in which the smallest blood vessels in the walls of the heart are narrowed or inelastic.

6840.definicao: The study of changes in the way the body works that result from disease.

6841.definicao: Unstable components of a preparation that evaporate easily.

6842.definicao: Professionally applied topical fluorides include higher-strength rinses, gels, and foams and fluoride varnishes;.

6843.definicao: A test to measure the amount of a type of sugar in the blood.

6844.definicao: Muscles attached to bones throughout the body that allow voluntary movement to occur.

6845.definicao: An autoimmune disease in which the body’s immune system mistakenly attacks myelin, the substance that covers nerve fibers.

6846.definicao: Paralysis of all limbs, often caused by a severe neck injury.

6847.definicao: The habitat in which an infectious agent normally lives, grows, and multiplies. Reservoirs include human, animal, and environmental reservoirs.

6848.definicao: A complication of diabetes in which substances called ketones build up in the blood to dangerously high levels.

6849.definicao: An adverse effect of both prostate surgery and some medications that causes semen to flow back into the bladder rather than out through the penis.

6850.definicao: Pain in the vulva that may or may not be brought on by touch or pressure.

6851.definicao: The oxygen-carrying substance that gives red blood cells their color.

6852.definicao: The layer of muscle in the bladder wall that squeezes urine out of the bladder.

6853.definicao: A narrowing of the mitral valve opening that limits blood flow from the left atrium to the left ventricle.

6854.definicao: The ringlike projection on each side of a vertebra to which muscles and ligaments are attached and, in the chest area, to which the ribs are connected.

6855.definicao: A thickening of nerve tissue between the toes that causes irritation, tingling, or a burning pain in the ball of the foot.

6856.definicao: The ability of the digestive tract to move its contents.

6857.definicao: Substances made by plants that have biological effects in the human body. Examples include isoflavones, lycopene, lutein, and zeaxanthin.

6858.definicao: The destruction or infection of tissues by disease-causing organisms, usually accompanied by a fever.

6859.definicao: That part of a limb that is farthest from the torso.

6860.definicao: A lipoprotein that transports triglyceride manufactured in the liver to fat tissue in the body. VLDL eventually becomes low-density lipoprotein (LDL) after the triglyceride has been removed.

6861.definicao: A group of drugs that lower blood pressure by blocking the effects of adrenaline or adrenaline-like substances on cells' alpha receptors. Also used to treat some prostate gland problems. Alpha blockers are also known as alpha-adrenergic antagonists, alpha-adrenergic blocking agents, and alpha-adrenergic blockers.

6862.definicao: The tearing away of one part of the body from another—for example, a tendon tearing away from a bone.

6863.definicao: Clear liquid that surrounds and protects the fetus throughout pregnancy.

6864.definicao: Relating to the lower, narrow part of the uterus (womb) located between the bladder and the rectum. It forms a canal that opens into the vagina, which leads to the outside of the body. The cervix is the narrow lower part of the womb. It is often referred to the neck of the womb or the entrance to the womb. 'Cervical' can refer to your neck as well – such as in your cervical vertebrae that make up the neck area of your spine.

6865.definicao: The highest amount of a nutrient deemed likely to have no harmful health effects for almost all healthy people when taken consistently.

6866.definicao: Results for GCSE subjects in England are graded U to 9, with grades 4-9 being equivalent to GCSE grades C and above.

6867.definicao: Substances that protect the body from molecules that damage cells (free radicals); examples include beta carotene, vitamin C, vitamin A, and vitamin E.

6868.definicao: The tough outer covering of the discs in the spine.

6869.definicao: The part of plant foods the body can’t digest or absorb. Also called roughage.

6870.definicao: Medications used to lower and control high blood pressure.

6871.definicao: A form of the hormone testosterone that spurs the prostate gland to enlarge (benign prostatic hyperplasia).

6872.definicao: Medications that quickly open the bronchial tubes by relaxing the muscles surrounding these airways.

6873.definicao: An ultrasound image of the carotid arteries.

6874.definicao: Treatment for kidney failure that uses a machine to remove toxins from the bloodstream.

6875.definicao: An ultrasound technique that makes images of the major arteries at the base of the brain.

6876.definicao: Reducing a substance to very small particles.

6877.definicao: A test used to detect glaucoma that examines the area where fluid drains out of the eye.

6878.definicao: A discipline in genetics that looks at the function and structure of genomes (the complete set of DNA within a single cell of an organism).

6879.definicao: The upper chambers of the heart. There are two of these—the right atrium and the left atrium.

6880.definicao: Seepage of blood out of a vein.

6881.definicao: This is a small drainage tube that is used to treat glue ear.

6882.definicao: The V-shaped hollow at the margin of the tooth and gum.

6883.definicao: Pain that persists after an injury has healed or a disease is over.

6884.definicao: Side vision, or what the eye perceives outside the direct line of vision.

6885.definicao: An antibody used to help diagnose rheumatoid arthritis.

6886.definicao: Surgical creation of an opening between the stomach wall and the small intestines; performed when the normal opening has been eliminated.

6887.definicao: Diagnostic procedure to detect breast tumors by the use of X-rays.

6888.definicao: Medication used to treat high blood pressure or an enlarged prostate gland.

6889.definicao: A chronic, progressive disease characterized by excessive and often compulsive drinking, impaired control over drinking, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol use is discontinued. Also known as alcoholism.

6890.definicao: Any substance that the body sees as harmful or foreign, causing the immune system to form antibodies in defense.

6891.definicao: Spidery-looking immune system cells that help protect the body from harmful substances.

6892.definicao: A mixture of water and salt, which is used to replace body fluids.

6893.definicao: One of two main types of skeletal muscle fibers. Fast-twitch fibers are recruited most heavily when bursts of power are needed, as in sprinting. See also slow-twitch fiber.

6894.definicao: People who overcome addiction without treatment or formal self-help programs.

6895.definicao: An early beat in an atria that feels like the heart skipped a beat.

6896.definicao: Fat that lies beneath the abdominal wall, in the spaces surrounding the liver, intestines, and other organs. Sometimes called belly fat or abdominal adiposity.

6897.definicao: A form of therapy that aimed at recognizing and changing negative thoughts and behaviors.

6898.definicao: Area between the chest and the hips that contains the stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, gallbladder, pancreas, and spleen.

6899.definicao: A weakening and ballooning of the wall of an artery in the brain.

6901.definicao: The extent of movement—and thus flexibility—in a joint, measured in the degrees of a circle.

6902.definicao: A painful spasm in the left upper abdomen below the rib cage, produced by areas of trapped gas in the colon.

6903.definicao: A type of injection that is given into a muscle.

6904.definicao: A small, fleshy flap of tissue that hangs from the back of the throat over the root of the tongue.

6905.definicao: Your blood flows all around your body through arteries, veins and capillaries. It's made up of different types of blood cell – red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets – all suspended in a liquid called plasma.

6906.definicao: Tearing of one of the walls of the heart. It usually occurs immediately after a heart attack.

6907.definicao: Sets out the rights that patients, the public and staff are entitled to, and the pledges that the NHS is committed to achieving.

6908.definicao: A test that uses sound waves to measure how fast blood is flowing through blood vessels.

6909.definicao: Agents or medications that dissolve blood clots and restore blood flow through a blocked artery; used to treat myocardial infarction, ischemic stroke, and pulmonary embolism. Also called clot busters. Examples include tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) and streptokinase.

6910.definicao: Forward displacement of a vertebra in relation to the vertebra immediately below.

6911.definicao: A pouch which is used to collect poo from a stoma (an opening made by a doctor) in a patient who is no longer able to poo naturally.

6912.definicao: This is a nasty infection you can get between your toes that is caused by a fungus. It’s very contagious so make sure you don’t walk around in bare feet when you’ve got it, and don’t share your shoes with anyone either. It can be treated using creams from your chemist.

6913.definicao: Any sleep other than REM sleep, in which thinking and most physiological activities slow, but movement still occurs. Also called non-REM sleep.

6914.definicao: Measurements that indicate how well the body is functioning, including pulse rate, respiration (breathing rate), temperature, and blood pressure.

6915.definicao: Involves the administration of live-saving chest compressions to someone who is not breathing or who has suffered a cardiac arrest.

6916.definicao: A chemical produced in the brain that reduces pain.

6917.definicao: Structures that are found in every cell, which carry genetic material that makes you like your parents. Chromosomes are arranged in pairs and each cell contains 22 pairs of chromosomes and two others called sex chromosomes. It’s the sex chromosomes that decide whether you’re male or female genetically. If you’re male, you have one X chromosome and one Y chromosome and if you’re female, you have two X chromosomes.

6918.definicao: A gas, which can be dangerous if we breathe it in for too long. Car exhausts and faulty gas fires produce it and its chemical symbol is CO.

6919.definicao: The science of the functions of living organisms.

6920.definicao: A detailed guide outlining the amounts and types of food a person should eat each day.

6921.definicao: The perception of flashing lights or lines that sometimes occurs during the aura of a migraine headache.

6922.definicao: The process of sewing tissues together after surgery; or the stitch itself.

6923.definicao: The name of a medication that sends a patient to sleep and stops them feeling pain during a surgical procedure by blocking signals from nerves to the brain.

6924.definicao: Physician specializing in the field of radiology (x-rays or other imaging technologies, such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease. Sometimes, doctors use special machines to take pictures of the inside your body. The pictures that they take look very strange, and radiologists help to look at them, so that the doctors can find out what's going on.

6925.definicao: Fewer than normal healthy red blood cells in circulation, caused by a lack of folate or vitamin B12. Red cells become large and deformed, and are unable to carry oxygen efficiently.

6926.definicao: A method that allows a person to control, within limits, the amount and timing of pain medication he or she receives. It is usually done by pressing a button to release the medication from a computerized pump into an IV.

6927.definicao: The amount of medicine you are supposed to take at a certain time. You should always follow the dose instructions your doctor or pharmacist gives you – taking too much or too little medicine can be dangerous.

6928.definicao: Two fatty acids, omega-3 and omega-6, that the body needs for good health but can’t make so they must come from foods and supplements.

6929.definicao: An itchy rash of usually short duration. Also known as hives.

6930.definicao: Abbreviation for electron-beam computed tomography, a high-speed imaging technology use to evaluate the heart and measure calcium deposits in arteries.

6931.definicao: The artery that supplies blood to the cerebellum, the brainstem, and the back of the brain.

6932.definicao: A substance that is very important for keeping your bone, hair and nails strong. It’s found in dairy products and some other foods too.

6933.definicao: A rounded knob at the end of a bone.

6934.definicao: Immunity from infection and disease that comes from the release of antibodies in the blood.

6935.definicao: Commonly used abbreviation for do-not-resuscitate order, a legal document that tells health professionals not to revive a person if his or her heart or breathing stops.

6936.definicao: A legal entity in which assets are gathered during a person’s lifetime. That person may control distributions directly or through trustees elected to carry out wishes at a time or point specified. After death, remaining assets are distributed to beneficiaries.

6937.definicao: A type of fat that is abundant in soybean, corn, cottonseed, safflower, and sunflower oils, as well as in fatty fish. One type, omega-3 fats, are especially important for cardiovascular health.

6938.definicao: An enlarged thyroid gland that creates a lump in the neck.

6939.definicao: Space inside the brain where cerebrospinal fluid circulates.

6940.definicao: A project to gain a better understanding of how certain traits and characteristics are passed on from parents to children.

6941.definicao: A network covering a broad area, ie any telecommunications network that links regional, national or international boundaries using leased telecommunications.

6942.definicao: A procedure in which diseased pulp tissue is removed from the pulp chamber and root canal and the area is sealed off.

6943.definicao: Some medicines can’t be swallowed and need to be absorbed into the body another way. Suppositories are put up your bottom where they dissolve and are absorbed through the blood vessels in your rectum.

6944.definicao: A valve on the left side of the heart that acts as a one-way gate, opening to allow blood to leave the left ventricle and closing to prevent blood from leaking back into that ventricle.

6945.definicao: The ability of a pathogen to withstand drugs previously effective against them. Usually the result of genetic mutation.

6946.definicao: A surgical procedure that involves removing excess skin and tightening the underlying muscle to correct sagging around the jaws, jowls, and neck. Does not include work on the eyes or forehead. Commonly known as a face lift.

6947.definicao: Any type of kidney disease that lasts longer than three months and impairs kidney function.

6948.definicao: One of two major blood vessels found on either side of the neck. The carotid arteries supply blood to the brain.

6950.definicao: The rate at which a man’s PSA level increases over time.

6951.definicao: A rare and potentially fatal disorder in which a person may stop breathing, especially at night. Also called congenital central hypoventilation syndrome.

6952.definicao: A surgical procedure to remove all or part of the thyroid.

6953.definicao: A life-threatening lack of oxygen due to drowning, choking, or an obstruction of the airways.

6954.definicao: A shoulder joint that connects the clavicle to the scapula.

6955.definicao: This is a flap of tissue in your throat that is normally open to let air flow into your lungs. When you eat, it flops down to cover your windpipe to stop food and drink getting into your lungs. When something ‘goes the wrong way’, this means that your epiglottis has let some food or drink into your windpipe by mistake and you need to cough to get rid of it.

6956.definicao: Surgical procedure in which a healthy blood vessel is transplanted from another part of the body into the heart to replace or bypass a diseased vessel.

6957.definicao: Also known as a pharmacist – this is the person who can advise you on medicines and supplies them to you either with or without a prescription.

6958.definicao: Extremely low levels of testosterone in circulation.

6960.definicao: The medical word for your chest.

6961.definicao: Abbreviation for C-reactive protein, a protein made by the liver. High amounts of C-reactive protein may indicate that arteries are clogged (atherosclerosis).

6962.definicao: An area of dead tissue caused by insufficient blood supply.

6963.definicao: Abbreviation for body-mass index, a measure of body fat estimated from a person’s height and weight. A healthy BMI is defined as 18.5 to 24.9. BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. Using English units, multiply weight in pounds by 703, then divide the result by height in inches, and divide that result by height in inches.

6964.definicao: A cannula is an extremely thin plastic tube that is put into a vein to give medicines or fluids or take sample of blood.

6965.definicao: A legal process of appointing a person to make decisions about important matters (such as health and finances) for someone who is unfit to make those decisions on his or her own.

6966.definicao: The sugars and starches in food that provide the body with most of its fuel. Carbohydrates are one of three primary nutrients along with fats and proteins.

6967.definicao: Manipulating the information from the CT scan to better visualize the part of the body that is being examined.

6968.definicao: Bacteria (germs) can sometimes make you ill and sometimes you need antibiotics to treat it. Antibiotics are medicines that attack bacteria that are making you feel unwell. Although they hurt the bacteria, they won't hurt you. Antibiotics don’t work again other infections from viruses or fungi.

6969.definicao: Surgery to remove fatty plaque that has built up on the walls of a coronary artery.

6970.definicao: Techniques used to restart circulation to part of the heart or brain that has been cut off from blood flow during a heart attack or stroke. Reperfusion may entail clot-dissolving drugs, balloon angioplasty, or surgery.

6971.definicao: A severe headache that occurs when orgasm is reached.

6972.definicao: A pain relief therapy that uses needles to deliver low-voltage electrical current under the skin to stop pain signals from reaching the brain.

6973.definicao: Related to the respiratory (breathing) system, which includes the nose, throat (pharynx), larynx, windpipe (trachea), lungs and diaphragm.

6974.definicao: Artificially made hormones used to manage menopausal symptoms.

6975.definicao: This consists of your trachea (windpipe), bronchi and lungs. Its job is to take the oxygen out of the air you breathe so it can be absorbed by the body.

6976.definicao: These are the smallest blood vessel – most of them are only big enough to allow a red blood cell through.

7264.definicao: Vivid dream-like sounds or images that occur while on the verge of falling asleep.
