7453.definicao: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath.

7454.definicao: Chemicals that cause airways to swell when an allergic reaction occurs or in diseases like asthma.

7455.definicao: Near the back of the body or an organ.

7456.definicao: A rare adrenal gland tumor that secretes hormones that narrow blood vessels and increase blood pressure.

7457.definicao: Pain and swelling in the tendons in the elbow, usually because of overuse.

7458.definicao: The sudden cessation of contractions capable of circulating blood to the body and brain. Also called sudden cardiac arrest. Cardiac arrest usually occurs as a result of a rapid ventricular rhythm (ventricular tachycardia) or a chaotic one (ventricular fibrillation). Death occurs within minutes unless cardiopulmonary resuscitation and defibrillation are available.

7459.definicao: Clear fluid that fills the front part of the eye.

7460.definicao: The inability to fall asleep or remain asleep long enough to feel rested.

7461.definicao: The branch of science that deals with how you inherit physical and behavioural characteristics, including medical conditions. Genes are what make you like your parents. They decide what colour your hair is, how tall you are and even what you sound like. They're like computer data that's carried on DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and decoded by your body.

7462.definicao: A condition in which the radial nerve is compressed at the elbow, causing pain, numbness, tingling, and muscle weakness in the hand and arm.

7463.definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as prolapsed disk.

7464.definicao: Surgery to remove the entire prostate.

7465.definicao: Inflammation of a tendon, usually caused by injury; may cause pain and restrict movement of the muscle attached to the tendon.

7466.definicao: Cosmetic surgery to minimize creases on the forehead and between the eyebrows, and to lift sagging eyebrows.

7468.definicao: Specialist who administers anesthetics (drugs or other agents to prevent or relieve pain during medical procedures) to a patient before being treated.

7469.definicao: A nerve cell that produces acetylcholine.

7470.definicao: Bone loss that results from a normal physiological process, such as menopause or aging.

7471.definicao: Something that develops slowly or is around for a long time. For instance, you can have chronic kidney disease, which develops slowly over a period of time.

7472.definicao: A protein that raises blood pressure by narrowing blood vessels and causing the kidneys to store more sodium and water.

7473.definicao: An automatic response to something. For instance, a doctor checks your reflex by hitting a special part of your knee that makes your leg move upwards.

7474.definicao: A cosmetic procedure in which tiny crystals under high pressure are sprayed on the face. This buffs away the outer layer of skin, eliminates fine lines, and improves the look of the skin.

7475.definicao: The external part of the ear, as well as the external ear canal and the eardrum.

7476.definicao: Part of the eye that produces the aqueous humor (fluid that nourishes the eye) and contains the ciliary muscle, which controls focusing of the lens.

7477.definicao: A multistage process by which sensation, perception, or thought is transformed into neural representations that can be stored in memory.

7479.definicao: The Nursing and Midwifery Council. A regulatory body that maintains a register of nurses, midwives and health visitors.

7480.definicao: A procedure to drain fluid from a joint using a syringe.

7481.definicao: The part of the jawbone that supports the teeth.

7482.definicao: In medical terms, this is a baby up to a year old.

7483.definicao: The fibrous sac that surrounds the heart and the roots of the major blood vessels.

7484.definicao: A small needle is inserted into the space between the lungs and the chest wall to remove fluid that has accumulated around the lung.

7485.definicao: The transition phase of the hair-growth cycle.

7486.definicao: Irritation and swelling of the esophagus.

7488.definicao: The procedure used to create a tracheostomy.

7489.definicao: How you take in oxygen from the air around us, and transfer it into your blood where it can travel all around your body.

7490.definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as herniated disk.

7491.definicao: An abnormal build-up of fatty plaque inside an artery.

7492.definicao: An investigation of the links between certain behaviors or risk factors and the occurrence of disease or good health in a population.

7493.definicao: Powerful tranquilizing drugs used to treat schizophrenia.

7494.definicao: Structures surrounding the prostate gland involved in storing secretions made by the gland.

7495.definicao: Muscular valve located at the upper portion of the esophagus that opens to allow food or liquid to enter the digestive system.

7496.definicao: A condition or disease of unknown origin.

7497.definicao: Pain from a disorder of the trigeminal nerve, the chief sensory nerve of the face. Also called trigeminal neuralgia.

7498.definicao: A test to measure the pressure inside the lower part of the esophagus.

7499.definicao: Bend a joint (for example, flexing the knees).

7500.definicao: A legal document that describes what should be done with a person's assets after his or her death.

7501.definicao: A procedure used to provoke known or suspected arrhythmias.

7502.definicao: A type of lipoprotein. It consists of remnants of very-low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) that eventually turn into low-density lipoprotein (LDL).

7503.definicao: X-rays allow the doctors to look inside your body, from the outside. The x-ray machine takes a picture, which helps them to see what's going on inside your body. The x-ray beams pass through soft tissue so looks black in the picture, but gets stopped by anything solid, such as bone, which shows white.

7504.definicao: A joint in which the bones are firmly connected by cartilage, so that only slight movement is possible.

7505.definicao: Pain from a disorder of the trigeminal nerve, the chief sensory nerve of the face. Also called tic douloureux.

7506.definicao: Not eating or drinking. Some people fast for religious reasons. In hospital, you have to fast for a certain amount of time before an anaesthetic.

7507.definicao: Vaccines that protect against harmful bacterial toxins. These vaccines contain toxins that have been detoxified and rendered inactive.

7508.definicao: A test involving red blood cells; used to check for different infections, inflammations, and cancers.

7509.definicao: A gland in the abdomen that produces digestive enzymes and hormones.

7511.definicao: Concern about sexual performance that is so severe that it leads to sexual dysfunction.

7512.definicao: Ability to maintain equilibrium while stationary or moving.

7513.definicao: Mucus that is coughed up from your windpipe. It’s also called phlegm. If your sputum is yellow or green this could mean you have an infection.

7514.definicao: Blood pressure that is above normal but not high enough to qualify as hypertension. An individual with prehypertension is at increased risk for developing hypertension.

7515.definicao: Surgery that brings one end of the large intestine out through an opening in the abdomen for elimination of stool.

7516.definicao: Inserting a flexible tube equipped with a light and camera into the body to see inside a body cavity or organ.

7517.definicao: Structures consisting of leaflets that divide the chambers of the heart and prevent the backflow of blood from one chamber to another during contraction of the heart.

7518.definicao: A chemical messenger released by nerve cells that transmits messages to nearby other nerve cells.

7519.definicao: A medication for treating benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlargement of the prostate gland).

7520.definicao: An instrument that magnifies internal structures of the eye with the aid of a thin beam of light. Also called a biomicroscope.

7522.definicao: A thin membrane that lines joint capsules and produces synovial fluid.

7523.definicao: Shorthand for erythrocyte sedimentation rate—a test involving red blood cells used to check for different infections, inflammations, and cancers.

7524.definicao: The inner layer of the wall of the heart.

7525.definicao: Paracetamol helps to stop things from hurting. It can also make reduce swelling and stop you feeling as hot. You should only ever take paracetamol according to the instructions on the bottle.

7526.definicao: Commonly used abbreviation for erectile dysfunction, the inability to get or maintain an erection sufficient for intercourse.

7527.definicao: The main sex hormone in women.

7528.definicao: Inflammation of the pericardium, the heart's sac-like covering.

7529.definicao: Any of several approaches to improve skin texture, tone, wrinkle appearance, and discolorations by promoting new collagen and epidermal growth. Chemical peels, dermabrasion, microdermabrasion, and laser procedures are skin-resurfacing techniques.

7530.definicao: The study of your digestive system. A doctor who specialises in disorders of the digestive system is called a gastroenterologist.

7531.definicao: Destructive change in skin tissue, such as a wound, injury, or inflammation.

7532.definicao: A sudden drop in blood pressure upon standing or getting out of bed, causing dizziness.

7533.definicao: Proteins found in heart muscle that leak into the circulation during a heart attack or other heart injury.

7534.definicao: A Holter monitor is a portable device that monitors the electrical activity in your heart over a 24-hour period. It involves putting stickers on your chest that link up to a recording device. This then monitors your heart rate, the shape of the complexes (in other words how each beat of your heart looks) and gives a very clear picture about how your heart rhythm is working.

7535.definicao: A substance that promotes breast milk production.

7536.definicao: A test that compares blood pressure at the ankle with blood pressure at the elbow. A difference between the two indicates the presence of peripheral artery disease.

7538.definicao: This is a type of white blood cell – there are three types of granulocyte – neutrophils, basophils and eosonophils.

7539.definicao: Use of a panel of light-emitting diodes (LEDs) to stimulate skin cells and improve the look of the skin.

Traduções.pt: ceratectomia: um procedimento no qual um laser é usado para corrigir problemas de visão remodelando a córnea. *
Traduções.es: Queratectomía: un procedimiento en el que se utiliza un láser para corregir problemas de visión remodelando la córnea. *
Traduções.en: keratectomy: a procedure in which a laser is used to correct vision problems by reshaping the cornea.

7540.Termo: keratectomy: a procedure in which a laser is used to correct vision problems by reshaping the cornea.

7541.definicao: Chemicals in the body that cause blood vessels to expand or relax, lowering blood pressure. Often referred to as EDRF.

7542.definicao: White blood cells that produce large quantities of antibodies as part of an immune system response.

7543.definicao: These are the smallest types of blood cell, which helps make your blood clot when you cut yourself.

7544.definicao: The name for a device that holds together a bone by pins that are inserted through the skin into the bone and held in place by a surrounding brace. It can help a broken bone to heal correctly but can also be used to lengthen a bone by gradually pulling the cut ends of the bone apart so that new bone forms in the gap.

7545.definicao: High blood pressure with no known cause; also called primary hypertension.

7546.definicao: This is when the surface of your head starts flaking, which leave you with white bits in your hair. It’s not catching but it doesn’t look nice. You can get rid of dandruff with a shampoo.

7547.definicao: Hard, tightly-packed tissue that forms the outer shell of bones. Also called cortical bone or lamellar bone.

7548.definicao: An increase in REM sleep, often with nightmares, that occurs after deprivation of REM sleep or the withdrawal of REM-suppressing medications.

7549.definicao: Long interlocking strands that make up muscle fibers.

7551.definicao: We have lots of muscles in our body – some are very small, others are very big. Muscles work by contracting (squeezing tight) and relaxing to make things move.

7552.definicao: A localized patch of gray or white hair on the scalp, eyebrows, or eyelashes.

7553.definicao: A condition in which the arch is flat all the time or flattens when bearing weight.

7554.definicao: A general term for antibiotics and other drugs that fight microscopic organisms in the body, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

7555.definicao: A memory that lasts from a few minutes to decades.

7556.definicao: A molecule on the surface of a brain cell that admits calcium when activated by the chemical messenger glutamate.

7557.definicao: Through the vagina (the passageway through which fluid passes out of the body during menstrual periods).

7559.definicao: Immune cells that remember harmful agents that have entered the body in the past. When they spot the substance again, they spur the immune system to eliminate the invader.

Traduções.pt: células t de memória e células b *
Traduções.es: células t de memoria y células b *
Traduções.en: memory t cells and b cells

7559.Termo: memory t cells and b cells

7561.definicao: Abbreviation for hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis, a system that controls many hormonal activities in the body, including the stress response.

7563.definicao: The most common form of heart disease, in which narrowed or blocked coronary arteries have difficulty supplying sections of the heart muscle with the blood they need (ischemia).

7564.definicao: A period of intense brain activity during sleep, often associated with dreams; named for the rapid eye movements that occur during this time. Also called dreaming sleep.

7565.definicao: A migraine where one or more of the symptoms, such as visual problems, linger for at least a day after the headache is gone.

7566.definicao: A blood clot that forms inside a blood vessel or chamber of the heart.

7567.definicao: Licensed skin care professional who performs procedures such as deep cleansing, low-grade chemical peels, microdermabrasion, and postsurgical skin care.

7568.definicao: A test for natriuretic peptide or brain natriuretic peptide, a hormone that is an indicator of how efficiently the heart is working.

Traduções.pt: teste de peptídeo natriurético/peptídeo natriurético cerebral (bnp) *
Traduções.es: Prueba de péptido natriurético/péptido natriurético cerebral (bnp) *

7569.definicao: The term used to describe babies that are born before 38 weeks of a mother’s pregnancy.

7570.definicao: If it's acute, it's strong or intense or comes on suddenly.

7571.definicao: A procedure used to examine the inside of the uterus (womb).

7572.definicao: When this starts a word, it means ‘too much’ of something.

7573.definicao: A prolonged reaction to a traumatic event. Post-traumatic stress disorder can cause crippling anxiety and leading to other problems, such as sleep disturbances, depression, and substance abuse. Often referred to as PTSD.

7574.definicao: A device used to inject a dose of medication (epinephrine) when a severe allergic reaction occurs.

7575.definicao: Abbreviation for gastroesophageal reflux disease, a condition in which food and acid flow back into the esophagus from the stomach, causing heartburn.

Traduções.pt: quelóide: uma cicatriz incomumente dura ou espessa que se forma após uma cirurgia ou lesão. *
Traduções.es: queloide: una cicatriz inusualmente dura o gruesa que se forma después de una cirugía o una lesión. *
Traduções.en: keloid: an unusually hard or thick scar that forms after surgery or an injury.

7576.Termo: keloid: an unusually hard or thick scar that forms after surgery or an injury.

7577.definicao: Use of medications containing the sex hormone estrogen by women to replace naturally-occurring estrogen lost during menopause.

7578.definicao: A flat sheet of muscles on the front of the abdomen, between the ribcage and the pelvis.

7579.definicao: A drooping of the eyelid attributed to weakened muscles.

7580.definicao: A minimally invasive procedure to stabilize compressed vertebrae and alleviate pain. A needle is inserted into the compressed portion of a vertebra and surgical cement is injected to support the vertebra and prevent further collapse.

7581.definicao: Also called Prinzmetal's angina, these are attacks of chest pain caused by spasms of one or more coronary arteries almost always while a person is at rest.

7582.definicao: An inherited disorder characterized by the formation of abnormal cysts in enlarged ovaries; a leading cause of female infertility and a common cause of hirsutism.

7583.definicao: A branch of psychology that studies mental health rather than illness, focusing on how life can be more happy and fulfilling.

7584.definicao: A test that shows how blood moves through the blood vessels and heart. It uses x-rays and the injection of a fluid called a contrast agent that can be seen on the x-rays.

7585.definicao: Competition ratios tell you how many applications were received relative to the number of places available.

7586.definicao: The veins that carry blood from the lungs to the left atrium.

7587.definicao: This is a substance that controls a chemical reaction within the body. There are lots of different enzymes and each does a different job. For instance, enzymes control how your food is broken down in your stomach.

7588.definicao: Another term for corticosteroids—steroid medications made to mimic hormones produced naturally by the adrenal glands. They are used to treat a wide range of health problems.

7589.definicao: If you have to apply a cream or ointment topically, that means you apply it to the surface of the skin that’s affected.

7590.definicao: An advanced stage of diabetic eye disease characterized by the development of new blood vessels that grow into the vitreous cavity; they are fragile and may bleed and cause loss of vision.

7591.definicao: Showing no signs or symptoms of disease, whether or not disease is present.

7592.definicao: Lipid-laden cells, named for their foamy appearance under the microscope. As foam cells build up on the inside of blood vessel walls, they form a plaque that can block blood flow.

7593.definicao: A growth of some kind. These days, it usually refers to a lump of cells that are growing in an uncontrolled way.

7594.definicao: A test to help evaluate thyroid function.

7595.definicao: A blood clot or particle that forms in one part of the body then moves through the bloodstream and lodges in a blood vessel elsewhere, blocking blood flow.

7596.definicao: Premedication or 'premed' is a special medicine that you are sometimes given before an operation (surgery). It's usually a liquid that you can drink and it helps to stop you worrying about the operation. Some types of pre-med help to dry up your mucus too.

7597.definicao: A compound produced by the endothelium (the lining of the interior walls of arteries) that helps widen blood vessels and counteract high blood pressure. Also called endothelium-derived relaxing factor.

7598.definicao: One of the three major nutrients, along with carbohydrates and proteins.

7600.definicao: A code used by all hospitals, physicians and insurance companies to identify a specific type of service or procedure.

7601.definicao: Plural of topology, an area of mathematics concerned with the properties of space.

7602.definicao: Character strengths such as curiosity, integrity, and modesty that people identify with, appreciate having, and enjoy using.

7603.definicao: The abdomen is actually just another word for your stomach.

7604.definicao: A disease where your joints swell and become stiff and painful. Some people think only old people get arthritis but it can affect young people too!

7607.definicao: A process in which oxygen combines with a substance, altering its structure and changing or destroying its normal function.

7608.definicao: A disorder caused by high levels of the stress-hormone cortisol resulting in damage to the body, including abdominal obesity, rounded red face, and other symptoms.

7609.definicao: A group of cells that form a small sac.

7610.definicao: A small, springlike cylinder, designed to relieve pressure from an enlarged prostate and improve urine flow by widening a narrowed urethra.

7611.definicao: A common phenomenon whereby people jump to a different expression of addiction. For example, people with heroin addiction might transition to alcohol addiction. Hopping is especially common during the recovery process.

7612.definicao: An antibody is a protein molecule that can bind to a virus and mark it for destruction by the immune system. A monoclonal antibody is a man-made substance used to treat some viral and other diseases.

7613.definicao: This is a serious illness where the meninges become inflamed, usually because of an infection. Some types of meningitis are very serious indeed, and need treatment very quickly.

7614.definicao: A molecule in the body that promotes the growth and repair of nerve cells.

7615.definicao: A yellow, lipid-laden deposit in the skin or on a tendon.

7616.definicao: The use of an electrical shock to stop an abnormal heart rhythm (an arrhythmia) and restore a normal one (sinus rhythm). Cardioversion can be external, using pads applied to the chest, or internal, from a pacemaker-like device called an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD).

7617.definicao: If you have blood in your wee, the doctors may say that you have haematuria. It’s usually caused by an infection in your urinary system. Sometimes, the amount of blood is so small, that you can only see it under a microscope.

7618.definicao: Age-related difficulty focusing the eyes at close range, as the flexible lens of the eye becomes less elastic.

7619.definicao: A type of fat found in animal foods such as meat, poultry skin, butter, and whole-milk dairy products, as well in as palm and coconut oils. A diet high in saturated fat tends to raise blood levels of unhealthy low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.

7620.definicao: A chemical that forwards a message from one neuron to another.

7621.definicao: An agent that is believed to aid in wound healing.

7622.definicao: The goal of perioperative care is to provide better conditions for patients before, during and after the operation. The time before and after an operation.

7623.definicao: Techniques conducted in a laboratory setting, where a glass dish or test tube is used for observations made outside the body. A well-known example is in vitro-fertilisation, where sperm and egg are fertilised outside the body.

7624.definicao: A chemical in the body that widens blood vessels in the penis. This increases blood flow to the penis, causing an erection.

7625.definicao: A drug used to treat schizophrenia and other severe mental health disorders; relieves symptoms such as delusions and hallucinations.

7626.definicao: Involuntary passing of urine or feces.

7627.definicao: An inflatable or bendable device that is implanted in the penis to allow a man with erectile dysfunction to have erections when he wishes.

7628.definicao: To examine a part of the body by touching it carefully.

7629.definicao: Proteins that kill viruses, bacteria, and other microbes directly or flag them for destruction by white blood cells.

7630.definicao: A non-hospital surgical facility dedicated to providing outpatient surgery and procedures.

7631.definicao: This is a collection of blood outside of a blood vessel. One of the most common forms of hematoma is bruising on the skin.

7632.definicao: If you've got an allergy, antihistamines can help to stop a bad reaction. They're usually tablets but sometimes you might be given a syrup, because it is easier to swallow. You can also get antihistamine cream that you put on your skin.

7633.definicao: A test that shows how blood moves through the blood vessels supplying the heart to identify narrowed arteries. It uses x-rays and the injection of a fluid called a contrast agent that can be seen on the x-rays.

7634.definicao: Abbreviation for low-density lipoprotein. This so-called bad cholesterol can build up on artery walls, narrowing the artery and making a heart attack or stroke more likely.

7635.definicao: The left upper chamber of the heart.

7636.definicao: A small electronic device generally placed in the chest to correct an irregular heartbeat. It generates small electrical pulses that prompt the heart to beat at a normal pace.

7637.definicao: A blood-sucking parasite commonly known as the louse (plural, lice) that can cause an itchy scalp; infestations are highly contagious and especially common in school-age children.

7638.definicao: The opening in the front of your eye that lets in light so that a picture forms on the retina at the back of your eye. Muscles control the pupil so that it is bigger when it is dark, and smaller when it is light. This stops too much light going into your eye.

7639.definicao: Chartered Institute for Environmental Health. An independent organisation representing the interests of the environmental health profession.

7640.definicao: A person who specializes in non-medical skin care and beauty treatments.

7641.definicao: Angina pectoris (chest pain with exertion or stress) that is well-controlled with medicines and lifestyle changes.

7643.definicao: Protrusion of part of an organ through the muscle that surrounds it. This is a condition where a muscle has a weak spot which lets your insides bulge out through it. It's fixed in an operation.

7644.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down the protein involved in clotting blood (fibrin), dissolving the clot.

7645.definicao: A chemical that narrows blood vessels, increases heart rate, and helps trigger the fight-or-flight response to danger. Also called adrenaline.

7646.definicao: A gland located in the middle of the brain, between the brain’s two hemispheres, that produces melatonin in response to declining light.

7647.definicao: A surgical procedure to open a narrowed vessel or tube, such as the urethra, esophagus, or artery. A small, deflated balloon is inserted into the area and inflated to widen it.

7648.definicao: An abnormal sound heard with a stethoscope in the carotid artery; people who have carotid bruits have a greater risk of having a stroke.

7649.definicao: Relating to the whole thing rather than just a part. In a health setting this means having a concern for the whole person, where body and mind are linked.

7650.definicao: A government program that offers health care for low-income Americans of any age.

7651.definicao: A drug that slows the production of hormones by the testicles in men or the ovaries in women.

Traduções.pt: agonista do hormônio liberador do hormônio luteinizante *
Traduções.es: agonista de la hormona liberadora de hormona luteinizante *

7652.definicao: A practice with its roots in Buddhism that encourages people to be more fully aware of the present moment. Often achieved through meditation.

7653.definicao: Instrument or substance used to destroy tissue by burning it with a hot iron, electric current, caustic, or by freezing it.

7654.definicao: A bump of bone or tissue that forms at the big toe joint, causing inflammation and considerable pain.

7655.definicao: A cancer that has spread from where it first developed into surrounding tissue.

7656.definicao: The clear, thin membrane that covers the inside of the eyelid and the white part of the eyeball.

7657.definicao: The total amount of bone tissue in the body.

7658.definicao: A cold is a type of viral infection that causes a runny nose and a sore throat. There’s no cure for a cold, but you can take medicines for the symptoms.

7659.definicao: An innate survival response in which certain hormones are released, increasing blood flow to the brain or heart. The stress response leads to an energy surge, enabling a person to flee dangerous situations. Ongoing stress, however, can sap energy and damage health.

7660.definicao: The most dangerous type of skin cancer.

7661.definicao: Any factor that can cause a person to be more likely to develop a disease. For example, smoking is a risk factor for lung cancer.

7662.definicao: Surgical removal of the synovial membrane that lines the joints.

7663.definicao: A mild form of mania, in which a person has lots of energy, talks faster than normal, has racing thoughts, and elevated mood.

7664.definicao: An inflammation of the bursa sac surrounding the joint in the heel of the foot, causing swelling and pain.

7665.definicao: A cable of specialized nerve fibers that transmit visual impulses from the eye to the brain.

7666.definicao: A type of cancer that affects your blood cells.

7668.definicao: A headache, usually mild or moderate in intensity, not accompanied by other symptoms; pain is usually felt throughout the head, across the forehead, or in the back of the head. Also known as a muscle-contraction headache.

7669.definicao: A small pouch or sac of tissue that bulges out of the colon wall. The plural form is diverticula.

7670.definicao: A substance that helps keep dirt out of the ear and lubricates the skin in the ear. More commonly known as earwax.

7671.definicao: An abnormal buildup of fluid in a joint or tissue.

7672.definicao: A circular drainage system in the eye located where the clear cornea, white sclera, and colored iris meet to form an angle.

7673.definicao: The inability of the heart to pump blood efficiently due to weakening and enlargement of the ventricles. Systolic heart failure is usually caused by coronary artery disease, high blood pressure, and valvular heart disease.

7675.definicao: The heart's normal rate and rhythm.

7676.definicao: Blockage in or damage to the lymphatic systems, causing lymphatic fluid to build up in tissues, making them swell.

7677.definicao: Abbreviation for transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation—the use of low-voltage electrical current (through electrodes placed on the skin) to provide pain-suppressing stimulation.

7678.definicao: A female steroid hormone produced by the ovaries that prepares the uterine lining for pregnancy.

7679.definicao: The part of the brain (in the frontal lobe of the left hemisphere) responsible for language comprehension and speech.

7680.definicao: The medical word for when you have trouble swallowing.

7681.definicao: A permanent hair removal technique that destroys follicles one at a time with a hair-thin needle inserted into the base of the follicle.

7683.definicao: Abbreviation for nitric oxide, a compound produced by the endothelium (the lining of the interior walls of arteries) that helps widen blood vessels and counteract high blood pressure. Also called endothelium-derived relaxing factor.

7684.definicao: This is what fights off infections. When you’re born, antibodies that are passed on protect you from your mum. As you grow older, you develop your own antibodies.

7685.definicao: A mark that’s left on your skin after an injury or operation.

7686.definicao: Sudden, severe confusion that occurs because of a mental or physical illness.

7687.definicao: This is the condition where the amount of glucose in the blood is too high.

7688.definicao: A hormone produced by adrenal glands that puts the body on heightened alert when a threat is perceived (the fight-or-flight response). Also known as norepinephrine.

7689.definicao: The branch of medicine that deals with the study and treatment of tumours, particularly cancerous tumours. The study of cancer, how it develops and how it can be treated. The doctor who specialises in oncology is called an oncologist.

7690.definicao: One of the four major subdivisions of the two hemispheres of the brain’s cerebral cortex. The temporal lobe plays a role in hearing, long-term memory, and behavior.

7692.definicao: A device that emits broadband light to improve the look of the skin or remove unwanted hair.

7693.definicao: A gene that will not be expressed in the offspring unless it is inherited from both the mother and father. A recessive gene from one parent that is paired with a dominant gene from the other parent will be overridden by the dominant gene.

7694.definicao: A test that checks for colorectal cancer by detecting blood in the stool.

Traduções.es: prueba de sangre oculta en heces *

7695.definicao: A hole, such as an ulcer, in an organ or tissue.

7697.definicao: A muscular valve at the lower end of the stomach that opens to the duodenum.

7698.definicao: Any type of swelling or enlargement of tissues; most often used to describe an abnormal growth of tissue, which can be cancerous or noncancerous.

7700.definicao: Bleeding in the brain caused by the rupture of a blood vessel; another term for hemorrhagic stroke.

7701.definicao: Cells of the epidermis that produce a tough protein called keratin and form a soft, protective sheet for the body.

7702.definicao: A surgical procedure that eases or eliminates the pain of spinal fractures. It also restores vertebrae that have collapsed due to fractures to their normal size.

7703.definicao: An autoimmune condition that appears as patchy hair loss on the scalp that may result in permanent hair loss.

7704.definicao: Sensitivities to certain foods that can cause symptoms ranging from the mild (like hives) to the life threatening (such as anaphylaxis).

7705.definicao: Relating to the surgically cutting of or into body tissues or organs.

7706.definicao: Nerve pain caused by the herpes zoster virus, also known as shingles.

7707.definicao: The part of the arm between the elbow and the wrist.

7708.definicao: The fluids that flows into your mouth from your salivary glands and the mucous membrane inside your mouth. It makes swallowing easier as it makes the food mushy.

7711.definicao: Structures on the outside of a cell membrane that permit attachment of specific chemicals.

7713.definicao: A person who typically evaluates all options before making a decision, in an effort to identify the perfect choice, and who never settles for second-best.

7716.definicao: Any hormone having the same effect as progesterone in the body; refers to both natural progesterone and synthetic progestin.

7717.definicao: Crescent-shaped cartilage between the upper end of the tibia (shin bone) and the femur (thigh bone).

7718.definicao: Enzymes secreted by the stomach to break down protein.

7726.definicao: The tube that carries food and liquids from the mouth to the stomach.

7727.definicao: Problems with memory, language, thinking, or other brain functions, varying from mild to serious difficulty.

7728.definicao: The process of removing an organ or other donated body part from one person and implanting it in another person.

7729.definicao: A group of substances found in food that the body converts into energy. Food containing carbohydrates include starchy foods such as potatoes, rice, pasta and bread.

7737.definicao: A test that sends sound waves to the eardrum to determine if a problem in the middle ear is causing hearing loss.

7738.definicao: A simple sugar found in corn syrup, honey, and many sweet fruits.

7739.definicao: An indentation in the optic disc that grows abnormally large with glaucoma.

7740.definicao: A rare disease brought on by severe niacin deficiency that causes diarrhea, dermatitis, and dementia.

7741.definicao: A procedure to attach two or more vertebrae with a bone graft in order to eliminate motion and relieve pain.

7742.definicao: An eye drop that constricts the pupil; used to treat glaucoma.

7743.definicao: A ranking of foods according to how quickly and how much they raise blood sugar.

7744.definicao: When two babies are born together, they’re twins. You can be an identical twin, which means the twins developed from the same egg, or non-identical twins which means that two eggs were fertilised at the same time.

7748.definicao: Temporary pause in breathing during sleep, lasting at least 10 seconds and associated with a fall in blood oxygen or arousal from sleep. Obstructive sleep apnea is caused by an obstruction in the airway blocking air flow; central sleep apnea occurs when the brain temporarily stops sending signals to the muscles that control breathing.

7749.definicao: A false or inactive medication or treatment that may still offer relief despite being ineffective. In clinical trials, the effectiveness of a new drug is often tested against a placebo.

7750.definicao: A endoscopic procedure that allows the examination of the lining of the rectum and the lower part of the colon. A long flexible tube is inserted, which has a camera and light at one end (known as an endoscope).

7752.definicao: A method of protecting the body against disease by injecting parts or all of a microorganism that will cause the body to develop antibodies against the microorganism and later fight off disease.

7755.definicao: A hormone that plays a key role in ensuring the absorption of calcium from the intestines.

7756.definicao: The amplification that a hearing aid produces across different sound frequencies.

7764.definicao: This is also called your colon and is where any water from your food is absorbed to form poo.

7765.definicao: Tissue that lines the tube-like structures of the body such as the respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts.

7768.definicao: The part of the cerebral cortex involved in processing information, rather than movement or sensory experiences.

7769.definicao: Abbreviation for human leukocyte antigen, a protein found on the surface of white blood cells that helps the body recognize and fight foreign substances.

7770.definicao: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) provides national guidance and advice to improve health and social care.

7771.definicao: The average price a self-pay patient will pay when in the hospital for an inpatient stay or outpatient procedure. Arrangements can be made to pay over time.

7773.definicao: Abbreviation for positron emission tomography, a medical imaging test that uses a radioactive substance to assess organ and tissue function in the body and to look for disease.

7779.definicao: Correction of a genetic defect by replacing an abnormal gene with a normal gene.

7780.definicao: An area of hardened, thickened skin usually caused by friction.

7783.definicao: Toward or on or near the belly.

7803.definicao: A tube leading from the eardrum to the outer ear.

7808.definicao: An inflammation of the heart lining or valves, usually caused by bacterial infection.

They may also write certain letters backwards or spell words wrong all the time. Teachers are getting much better at spotting children with dyslexia now, so they can make learning easier for you.

Some of them are given as a series of injections, where you have one when you’re a baby and then others as ‘boosters’.

7817.definicao: The release of chemical substances produced by the body; or the substance that is produced.

7825.definicao: A group of structures in the brain that help control memory, emotions, sexual arousal, and motivation.

7826.definicao: A gas, which we breathe out into the atmosphere. Its chemical symbol is CO2

7834.definicao: The state of being awake or reactive to stimuli through one or more of the five senses.

7836.definicao: A thin, flexible tube equipped with a light and camera that is used to see inside an organ or body cavity.

7837.definicao: A place where a ligament, tendon, or muscle attaches to bone.

7840.definicao: Drugs used to treat an overactive thyroid.

7842.definicao: A groove in front of the femur where the patella moves as the knee bends and straightens.

7846.definicao: Nerve endings that detect pain and transmit pain information to the brain and spinal cord.

7848.definicao: Stinging, burning, or irritation that occurs when the eye doesn’t produce enough moisture.

7849.definicao: A physician who specializes in treating the eye and eye disease.

7850.definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as prolapsed disk or herniated disk.

7852.definicao: A simple hearing test that uses a tuning fork to determine what type of hearing loss a person has.

7853.definicao: Popular term for exercises that harness resistance supplied by body weight, free weights such as dumbbells or weighted cuffs, resistance bands, or specialized machines; also known as resistance training or weight training.

7857.definicao: Surgical removal of plaque or blood clots in an artery.

7860.definicao: Something firmly fixed into place, such as a wisdom tooth.

7861.definicao: The lining of many parts of the body, like your nose and mouth. They let out a fluid (mucus) that keeps everything moist.

7862.definicao: Having a sensitivity to one or more normally harmless substances.

7863.definicao: A substance or condition that causes blood vessels to open wider and increase the flow of blood.

7864.definicao: Pertaining to or caused by a virus.

7865.definicao: The liver is the largest organ in your body. Its job is to produce and keep control of the chemicals circulating in your body, removing any waste products from the blood. In adults, the liver weighs around one kilogram.

7866.definicao: This is what makes red blood cells red. It’s a kind of pigment that carries the oxygen to all parts of your body. Each red blood cell contains about 350 million haemoglobin molecules!

7867.definicao: The surgical removal of a limb or other body part.

7868.definicao: Correction or realignment of a broken bone.

7870.definicao: Substances injected into the skin to fill in wrinkles or add plumpness to the lips.

7871.definicao: Physician who identifies diseases by studying cells and tissues under a microscope.

7872.definicao: A group of people who meet to discuss and offer assistance to one another with the goal of providing social support for changing troubling behavior patterns.

7873.definicao: If you're contagious, it means that anyone around you can catch your illness. This is more common than you might think - colds are contagious, because you can catch them from someone else.

7875.definicao: An energy-storing molecule that is found in all human cells. Usually abbreviated as ATP.

7876.definicao: Continuing consumption of alcohol despite alcohol-related social or interpersonal problems.

7878.definicao: The internal organs, especially those found in the abdomen.

7880.definicao: Vitamins, minerals, herbs, and other substances taken in hopes of improving health.

A sprain is very painful and will probably swell up a lot. You should put ice on the area and raise it up to reduce the swelling and rest it until it doesn’t hurt anymore.

7882.definicao: Clusters of hormone-producing cells, including alpha and beta cells, that appear throughout the pancreas.

7883.definicao: Estimated average hospital charges do not include physicians fees such as your surgeon, anesthesiologist, pathologist or radiologist. They will bill you separately for their services.

7884.definicao: Pain or discomfort in the upper abdomen; upset stomach or indigestion.

7885.definicao: The most superficial layer of the epidermis.

7886.definicao: The premature death of living cells or tissues.

7888.definicao: Medications, including alendronate and etidronate, used to prevent and treat osteoporosis by slowing the breakdown of bone.

7889.definicao: A drug or other substance such as aspirin, acetaminophen, or morphine that is used to relieve pain.

7890.definicao: A mineral that is required only in tiny amounts in the diet to maintain health; the principal trace minerals are chromium, copper, selenium, sulfur, and zinc.

7893.definicao: Pertaining to something that affects the whole body rather than separate organs or parts.

7894.definicao: High levels of insulin in the bloodstream.

7895.definicao: A tube connecting the middle ear and the back of the nose that lets air into the middle ear.

7896.definicao: A small pocket of fluid that develops between the upper layers of skin; often caused by friction or burns.

7901.definicao: Relating to the colon or rectum.

7902.definicao: A pattern of falling asleep and waking up earlier than wanted that worsens progressively over time.

Traduções.es: síndrome de fase avanzada del sueño *

7903.definicao: Small organs located in the channels of the lymphatic system which store special cells to trap bacteria or cancer cells traveling through the lymph vessels.

7904.definicao: The study of hearing. An audiologist is a person who studies your hearing and can suggest ways of improving it if you have problems.
